intro: Mollinedia ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaved mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Mollinedia ovata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
